FuncDef:
The attack-source-trace sample-rate command sets the sampling ratio for the packets that are recorded by attack source tracing.
By default, the sampling ratio for the packets that are recorded by attack source tracing is 1:1000.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the sampling ratio for the packets that are recorded by attack source tracing.
The value is an enumerated type and can be 1, 10, 100, or 1000. The default value is 1000.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The values of 1, 10, 100, and 1000 correspond to the sampling ratios of 1:1, 10:1, 100:1, and 1000:1, respectively.
Total CAR has a fixed sampling ratio of 1000:1 for the packets that are recorded by attack source tracing.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
